greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of psi(-x) * phi(x)^4 in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/8) * eta(q^2)^19 / (eta(q) * eta(q^4))^7 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (256 t)) = 1024 (t/i)^(5/2) f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, x]^4 QPochhammer[ x] / QPochhammer[ x^2, x^4], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A);  if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A)^19 / (eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) )^7, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jun 09 2015
